title: High Dependency on Child Labor in Agriculture
description: In 2015, 94.65% of economically active children aged 7-14 in Gambia were employed in agriculture, with 97.29% of them being female and 92.75% male. This indicates a significant reliance on child labor in the agricultural sector.

title: Prevalence of Unpaid Child Labor
description: In 2015, 94.62% of children aged 7-14 in employment were unpaid family workers, with 94.66% being male. This highlights a major issue of unpaid child labor in Gambia.

title: Significant Child Labor in Work Only
description: In 2015, 56.63% of children aged 7-14 in employment were engaged in work only, with 57.16% being male and 55.95% female. This reflects a high level of child labor focused solely on work activities.

title: Strong Social Safety Net Programs
description: In 2015, social safety net programs in Gambia accounted for 55.15% of the total welfare of beneficiary households, indicating a robust support system for vulnerable populations.

title: High Export Rate to Low- and Middle-Income Economies
description: In 2023, 97.38% of Gambia's merchandise exports were directed to low- and middle-income economies outside the region, showcasing a strong export strategy towards these markets.

title: Strong Trade Links with Europe & Central Asia
description: In 2023, 96.95% of Gambia's merchandise exports were to low- and middle-income economies in Europe & Central Asia, highlighting significant trade connections with these regions.

title: Low Food Production Index
description: In 2022, Gambia's food production index was recorded at 71.08, indicating a significant challenge in agricultural productivity compared to the global average.

title: Minimal Contribution of Communications to Service Exports
description: As of 2023, communications and computer services accounted for only 1.12% of Gambia's service exports, highlighting a potential area for growth in the digital economy.

title: Limited Digital Public Services for Business Entry
description: In 2024, Gambia scored 8.33 in digital public services and transparency for business entry, suggesting room for improvement in facilitating business operations.

title: Challenges in Business Location Attractiveness
description: Gambia's overall score for business location was 33.42 in 2024, indicating potential barriers for attracting businesses to the country.

title: Moderate Labor Market Conditions
description: With a score of 49.22 in 2024, Gambia's labor market conditions show moderate performance, suggesting a need for further development to enhance workforce capabilities.

title: Regulatory Challenges in Utility Services
description: In 2024, Gambia scored 36.46 in the quality of regulations on utility services, indicating regulatory challenges in this sector.

title: Low Coverage of Social Safety Nets for the Richest Quintile
description: In 2015, only 0.55% of the richest quintile in Gambia were covered by social safety net programs, highlighting a disparity in social protection.

title: Minimal Child Employment in Manufacturing
description: In 2015, only 0.08% of female economically active children aged 7-14 were employed in manufacturing, reflecting low child labor in this sector.

title: Child Employment in Services Sector
description: In 2015, 2.71% of economically active children aged 7-14 were employed in the services sector, indicating a notable presence of child labor in this area.

title: High Rate of Children in Employment, Study, and Work
description: In 2015, 43.37% of children aged 7-14 were engaged in employment, study, and work, highlighting a significant challenge in balancing education and labor.

title: Low Child Wage Employment
description: In 2015, only 0.85% of children aged 7-14 were employed as wage workers, suggesting limited formal employment opportunities for children.
